Edna St. Vincent Millay (February 22, 1892  October 19, 1950) was an American 
poet and playwright. She received the Pulitzer Prize for Poetry in 1923, the third 
woman to win the award for poetry, and was also known for her feminist activism. 
She used the pseudonym Nancy Boyd for her prose work. .... Both Millay and
